alert.note: Alert for Waller; Washington (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 24 at 7:48AM CST until further notice by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Texas, including the following counties, Brazos, Grimes, Waller and Washington. * WHEN...Until 145 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 748 AM CST, Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area due to previous local rainfall and upstream runoff. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Navasota, Washington, Anderson, Roans Prairie and Richards. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
